title: HTML Abbreviation Tag
shortDescriptionOfTheTag: The HTML 'abbr' tag is used to denote an abbreviation or acronym. The 'title' attribute can be used to present the full version of the abbreviation/acronym when the user hovers their mouse over the text.

usageExamples.title: Simple Use Of 'abbr' Tag
usageExamples.description: This example shows how to use the 'abbr' tag to denote an abbreviation.
usageExamples.code: The WHO was founded in 1948.

usageExamples.title: Using 'abbr' With CSS
usageExamples.description: This example shows how to use CSS with the 'abbr' tag to provide a visual cue that the text is an abbreviation.
usageExamples.code: The WHO was founded in 1948.
